5415.verse: فَلَآ|But nay!|76|91|208$أُقْسِمُ|I swear|69|100|16602$بِرَبِّ|by (the) Lord|108|139|6704$ٱلْمَشَـٰرِقِ|(of) the rising|111|142|14566$وَٱلْمَغَـٰرِبِ|and the settings,|134|165|17342$إِنَّا|that We|74|89|120$لَقَـٰدِرُونَ|(are) surely Able|130|130|12243$

5417.verse: فَذَرْهُمْ|So leave them|115|132|5958$يَخُوضُواْ|(to) converse vainly|154|188|4558$وَيَلْعَبُواْ|and amuse themselves|170|204|15568$حَتَّىٰ|until|64|98|526$يُلَـٰقُواْ|they meet|88|105|15569$يَوْمَهُمُ|their Day,|85|180|15570$ٱلَّذِى|which|65|256|138$يُوعَدُونَ|they are promised,|144|239|11281$

5426.verse: وَإِنِّى|And indeed, I|108|119|2795$كُلَّمَا|every time,|95|118|174$دَعَوْتُهُمْ|I invited them|112|135|17353$لِتَغْفِرَ|that You may forgive|160|183|17354$لَهُمْ|them,|58|81|98$جَعَلُوٓاْ|they put|78|89|9399$أَصَـٰبِعَهُمْ|their fingers|106|124|162$فِىٓ|in|48|84|89$ءَاذَانِهِمْ|their ears|87|122|163$وَٱسْتَغْشَوْاْ|and covered themselves|181|216|17355$ثِيَابَهُمْ|(with) their garments|161|179|8370$وَأَصَرُّواْ|and persisted|109|192|17356$وَٱسْتَكْبَرُواْ|and were arrogant|142|308|4685$ٱسْتِكْبَارًا|(with) pride.|103|186|14426$

5429.verse: فَقُلْتُ|Then I said,|99|126|17361$ٱسْتَغْفِرُواْ|`Ask forgiveness|131|184|8360$رَبَّكُمْ|(from) your Lord.|133|186|6461$إِنَّهُۥ|Indeed, He|92|145|396$كَانَ|is|57|84|913$غَفَّارًا|Oft-Forgiving.|112|112|17362$

5415.verse: So I swear by the Lord of [all] risings and settings that indeed We are able

5416.verse: To replace them with better than them; and We are not to be outdone.

5417.verse: So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised -

5418.verse: The Day they will emerge from the graves rapidly as if they were, toward an erected idol, hastening.

5419.verse: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. That is the Day which they had been promised.

5420.verse: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment."

5421.verse: He said, "O my people, indeed I am to you a clear warner,

5422.verse: [Saying], 'Worship Allah, fear Him and obey me.

5423.verse: Allah will forgive you of your sins and delay you for a specified term. Indeed, the time [set by] Allah, when it comes, will not be delayed, if you only knew.' "

5424.verse: He said, "My Lord, indeed I invited my people [to truth] night and day.

5425.verse: But my invitation increased them not except in flight.

5426.verse: And indeed, every time I invited them that You may forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears, covered themselves with their garments, persisted, and were arrogant with [great] arrogance.

5428.verse: Then I announced to them and [also] confided to them secretly

5429.verse: And said, 'Ask forgiveness of your Lord. Indeed, He is ever a Perpetual Forgiver.
